fullText: The Boys in the Band remains a landmark play, and this revival honors it with a production that is both faithful to its period and vibrantly alive for ours.
dtliExcerpt: The Boys in the Band remains a landmark play, and this revival honors it with a production that is both faithful to its period and vibrantly alive for ours.
bwwExcerpt: To some degree, at least, we seem to have learned. The keen-edged and engrossing 50th-anniversary revival of The Boys in the Band-which is also the play's Broadway debut-is the creation of five openly gay producers, an openly gay director (the redoubtable Joe Mantello) and nine openly gay actors. No one seems worried about being role models; they focus on their roles, and on Crowley's favorful dialogue, whose basic bitterness is frequently cut with acid.
